baseline.name: Baseline Criteria
baseline.description: Basic English customer service ability and polite, helpful tone

experience.name: Experience & Responsibilities
experience.description: Credibility check for relevant work experience and responsibilities

knowledge.name: Knowledge Checks
knowledge.description: Technical knowledge of banquet service procedures

core_duties: Set up / break down event space (linens, flatware, buffet stations)
Serve food and beverages (deliver plated meals, pour/refill wine/water)
Clear and reset tables (pre-bussing, full resets)
Team communication (work with captains, kitchen, bartenders)

evaluation.review: Vague workplace, no timeframe, or only 1 duty

place_setting.question: How do you know if a place setting is correct? Describe it.
place_setting.ideal: Forks on left (salad fork outside, entrée fork inside), knife and spoon on right, napkin folded, bread plate with butter knife above forks, wine glass at tip of knife, water glass above/right, all aligned evenly
place_setting.acceptable: Mentions multiple correct placements (e.g., fork left, knife right, glasses on right)

wine_service.question: When pouring wine, which side do you approach from, and why?
wine_service.ideal: From the right, because glasses are on the right and beverages are served from the right

clearing.question: From which side do you clear plates?
clearing.ideal: From the right, to avoid reaching across guests

guest_scenario.question: If a guest says they are vegetarian but their entrée has meat, what do you do?
guest_scenario.ideal: Apologize, notify captain/chef, offer an alternative, ensure guest satisfaction
guest_scenario.acceptable: Tell the chef and replace it
guest_scenario.red_flag: Ignore them, Tell them to eat it

greeting.question: How would you greet a guest when they arrive at your table?
greeting.ideal: Good evening, welcome! May I start you with water or a drink?

complaint.question: If a guest says their food is cold, what do you do?
complaint.ideal: I'm so sorry about that. I'll take it back and have it fixed right away
complaint.acceptable: I'll bring it back to the kitchen
complaint.red_flag: Not my problem, Just eat it

bartender.name: Bartender
bartender.english_notice: This interview is conducted in English since bartenders must be able to interact with guests in English. If you are not comfortable continuing in English, you may end the interview here.

baseline.name: Baseline Criteria
baseline.description: English fluency and responsible alcohol service judgment

experience.name: Experience & Responsibilities
experience.description: Credibility check for relevant bartending experience and responsibilities

knowledge.name: Knowledge Checks
knowledge.description: Technical knowledge of bartending skills, glassware, recipes, and tools

core_duties: Preparing and serving drinks (cocktails, beer, wine, non-alcoholic)
Setting up and maintaining the bar (stocking, cleaning, organizing tools/glassware)
Taking and processing orders, handling payments
Responsible alcohol service (checking IDs, cutting off intoxicated guests)

cosmopolitan_glass.question: In what glass would you typically serve a Cosmopolitan?
cosmopolitan_glass.red_flag: Wrong glass (rocks, highball, etc.) or vague answer

old_fashioned_glass.question: In what glass would you typically serve an Old Fashioned?
old_fashioned_glass.ideal: Lowball glass, rocks glass, or old fashioned glass
old_fashioned_glass.acceptable: Short glass, rocks glass, or whiskey glass
old_fashioned_glass.red_flag: Wrong glass (martini, highball, etc.) or vague answer

margarita.question: What are the basic ingredients in a Margarita?
margarita.ideal: Tequila, triple sec/orange liqueur, lime juice, salt rim
margarita.red_flag: Leaves out tequila or nonsense recipe

old_fashioned.question: What are the basics of an Old Fashioned?

tools.question: What tools would you use to shake and strain a cocktail?
tools.red_flag: Doesn't know tools / says just pour it

responsible_service.question: If a guest is overly intoxicated, how do you handle it?
responsible_service.ideal: Politely cut them off, offer water, suggest food, offer taxi/ride

host.name: Host
host.english_notice: This interview is conducted in English since hosts must be able to interact with guests in English. If you are not comfortable continuing in English, you may end the interview here.

core_duties: Assigning tables based on server sections / bandwidth
Answering phone calls, taking guest info
Handling to-go orders over the phone
Resolving discrepancies (lost reservations, unexpected party sizes)

pos_system.question: Have you used a reservation system like Toast, OpenTable, or Resy? How do you use it?
pos_system.ideal: Create/update reservations, check guest notes, manage table flow, update waitlist
pos_system.acceptable: Yes, I enter guest info and track tables
pos_system.red_flag: No, never used it (unless strong other experience)

seating_logic.question: When assigning tables, how do you decide where to seat guests?
seating_logic.ideal: Balance server sections, spread tables based on bandwidth, consider guest preferences
seating_logic.acceptable: Seat them where there's an open table, but try to spread evenly
seating_logic.red_flag: Seat randomly / First table I see

phone_etiquette.question: What information should you collect when a guest calls to make a reservation?
phone_etiquette.ideal: Name, party size, time/date, phone number, special notes (allergies, celebrations)

lost_reservation.question: How would you handle a guest who arrives saying they have a reservation, but you don't see it in the system?
lost_reservation.ideal: Apologize, try to accommodate (find a table, offer waitlist priority), communicate clearly
lost_reservation.acceptable: Tell them I'll try to fit them in
lost_reservation.red_flag: Tell them to leave / Not my problem

large_walkin.question: How do you handle a walk-in group of 10 guests?
large_walkin.ideal: Check if space can be rearranged, note wait time, split into sections if needed, flag servers for support
large_walkin.acceptable: Tell them the wait time, try to seat them together
large_walkin.red_flag: Seat them anywhere without checking / Refuse without explanation
